posts.name:
Angel Ngele
Angel Ngele
posts.content:
Soft skills are the No.1 strategy in the world to take your Career/ Business from 0 - 

They help you connect with people, share your ideas, and stand out in any room.

But here‚Äôs the thing, most people don‚Äôt work on them enough.

Short story: I‚Äôve met so many talented individuals who struggle to express their thoughts clearly or build strong relationships.

They have the skills, but not the communication to match.

What most people think:
1. "I‚Äôm just not a good communicator."
2. "Soft skills don‚Äôt matter as much as hard skills."
3. "I‚Äôll figure it out eventually."

What you should be thinking:
1. Communication is a skill you build, not something you‚Äôre born with.
2. Being a better communicator opens doors you didn‚Äôt even know existed.
3. Small improvements in your soft skills can lead to big results in your career and life.

Bonus: People who communicate well are often seen as leaders, even if they‚Äôre not the most experienced in the room.

If you want to get better at soft skills like communication, start small:
- Practice active listening.
- Learn how to explain your ideas simply.
- Give people your full attention in every conversation.

The results will surprise you.

Want to become a better communicator?

Watch this till the end, I‚Äôve shared tips that can help you right away.

P.S. Soft skills aren‚Äôt ‚Äúsoft.‚Äù They‚Äôre the real deal. Don‚Äôt sleep on them.

comments.commentText:
And In today's AI era, soft skills are more important than ever. 

While many can master hard skills, it's the ability to communicate, adapt, and collaborate that sets top performers apart
Communication skill isnt mean speaking louder it's all about speaking clear & actively listening too Angel Ngele

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Investing in soft skills opens doors and fosters meaningful connections. Small steps can lead to significant growth! üöÄ

You keep failing because you don't take advantage of opportunities 

For you, everything is a SCAM.

Especially on this blue app (Linkedin), so you keep scrolling endlessly.

A few days ago, I shared an opportunity to take the Content Marketing Certification with HubSpot Academy. A few persons jumped on it, others DIDN'T, thinking it was just another course

But here‚Äôs the thing: This wasn‚Äôt just any course, for me, It was a masterclass in creating content that drives results, connects with audiences and builds lasting brand impact. And now, I‚Äôm proud to say I‚Äôve successfully completed it

This wasn‚Äôt ‚Äújust another course.‚Äù It was an investment in knowledge that opened my eyes to:

Ô∏èThe strategy behind value-driven content especially blogs, articles and SEO

Ô∏èHow to create stories that connect and convert

Ô∏èThe importance of measuring and optimizing every piece of content

To those who dismissed it, I have to say that you missed out on a game-changing opportunity and it's sad because you felt it wasn't important.

To those who took action, welcome to a new world of possibilities. Send me a Dm, let's grow together

And to you, reading this: What‚Äôs stopping you from investing in yourself and your growth?

Opportunities are everywhere but they‚Äôre only as good as the action you take.

I'm, a Growth Marketer. I share my professional journey to empower young marketers. I also share resources like Mentorship program, courses and job vacancies to young professionals seeking global opportunities. If this is your thing, ensure you follow for more valuable content

Have you heard of the "Holy Trifecta of AI"? If you've worked with GoWest.ai you have. For those we haven't worked with, there are 3 things we recommend to every single client we work with:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Develop AI Policies
Without clear guidelines, shadow AI (unapproved tools used by employees) can create chaos. Developing robust AI policies prevents misuse, ensures data security, and aligns AI adoption with your organization's goals. It‚Äôs not just a rulebook‚Äîit‚Äôs your strategic playbook for the future.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Implement an AI Meeting Assistant
Time is precious, especially for sales reps. That‚Äôs why we use timeOS (). It seamlessly integrates with our CRM, offers customizable features, and even provides automated call scoring based on training. Imagine knowing how a call went without lifting a finger‚Äîit‚Äôs a game-changer for sales teams looking to improve performance and close more deals.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Use Enterprise-Grade AI
Security and creativity should never be at odds. Tools like ChatGPT Team Edition, MS Copilot Pro, and Gemini Advanced ensure your data stays protected while empowering your teams to unleash their full potential. These platforms allow businesses to innovate with confidence, combining security with functionality.

Ready to build your trifecta? Let‚Äôs talk about how to make it happen. Message me to get started.

posts.name:
Jennifer Bleam, Sales Sherpa
Jennifer Bleam, Sales Sherpa
posts.content:
Pineapple. Pizza. And Sales.
 
The other night, my family had a "build your own pizza" night.

Everyone got exactly what they wanted ‚Äì extra cheese for one, no mushrooms for another, and some amazing turkey sausage for me.

Sales works the same way.

Every prospect has unique preferences, pain points, and priorities.

Your job is not to push a one-size-fits-all solution.

That‚Äôs like FORCING someone to eat pineapple on their pizza.
We all know how that goes.

Your real job? Discover their needs.

(Hence the word discovery...)

Then customize their experience to match what they‚Äôre truly looking for.

Take a look at the way you show up in sales conversations.

Do you stick to a ‚Äúset menu,‚Äù pitching the same features and benefits to every prospect?

YAWN.

Or do you ask questions, listen, and deliver EXACTLY what they need?

Think about pizza toppings ‚Äì NO ONE wants pineapple on their pizza.

Unless, of course, they DO want pineapple.

In that case, it‚Äôs your job to give it to them.

Because sales isn‚Äôt about what YOU think is great.

It‚Äôs about giving your prospect exactly what THEY want.
posts.commentAdded: Love the pizza analogy! üçï Tailoring solutions to each prospects unique needs is key. Its all about custom experiences in sales! #SalesStrategy

posts.content:
Do you use AI every day? ‚ÄçÔ∏è
According to the 2025 ETS Human Progress Report: The Female Edition in partnership with The Female Quotient, 59% of women are already gaining AI skills and using it regularly. And this isn‚Äôt just important‚Äîit‚Äôs essential. Here‚Äôs why:

Artificial intelligence is not just a tool; it‚Äôs the blueprint for the future. AI is shaping how we live, work, and connect, influencing everything from healthcare to education to hiring practices. But here‚Äôs the challenge: AI is only as good as the data and perspectives it‚Äôs built on. When women are underrepresented in AI development, biases‚Äîboth hidden and overt‚Äîbecome baked into the algorithms that impact billions of lives.

Women must be at the forefront of this revolution, leading the charge to ensure AI works for everyone, not just a select few. When women are empowered to shape AI, we ensure that its potential is fully realized‚Äîfor fairer systems, smarter solutions, and a better future for all.
Let‚Äôs make sure women don‚Äôt just use AI, but lead its transformation. An inclusive future depends on it. Read more from the report:

posts.name:
Salesty - a sales community
Salesty - a sales community
posts.content:
Here is an unpopular opinion‚Ä¶.


When it comes to identifying sales talent, college doesn‚Äôt matter.

A lot of thought, deliberation, and vetting went into every hiring decision I‚Äôve made while building several start-up sales teams over my career.

But one thing I‚Äôve never considered much is where (or if) a candidate went to college, or what they studied.

Show me evidence of grit, curiosity and problem solving and you‚Äôve got my attention.

Show me a fancy degree without examples of overcoming adversity or excelling in some area of your life, and I‚Äôm skeptical you‚Äôll be able to handle the rigors of selling in a start-up environment.

I believe you can train someone on your product, competitors, and how to sell, but you‚Äôll never teach them to be driven, goal-oriented, and hungry.

That comes from within.

Hiring for personality traits that can‚Äôt be taught has served me well in my career.

How much do you weigh college credentials when hiring salespeople?

comments.commentText: Adversity either sharpens and hones or breaks. The difference is found in the metal of the person. So it make sense that skills like grit and resilience aren‚Äôt tied to a college degree. But I do think that learning to think well and critically is something that has to be taught. Learning how to lean outside of our own intellect and into unknowns without defining those unknowns based on subjective data is important, too. Where do you think those skills are developed? I would have said college but I‚Äôve met a lot of highly educated stagnant people.
Rebecca Anderson Excellent points...thanks for sharing!

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Skills and mindset often outweigh degrees, especially in dynamic sales environments. Grit and curiosity are key!

posts.name:
Snehal Talati
Snehal Talati
posts.content:
"AI, AI everywhere..." as Buzz Lightyear might say

Remember 2010 when everyone suddenly became "Agile"? Scrum Masters sprouted up like mushrooms after rain, and sticky notes became their own form of currency.

But here's the reality check we all need: Just like how slapping "2-week sprints" on waterfall didn't magically make you agile, adding .predict() to your code doesn't make you an AI engineer.

True story: Had a stakeholder recently ask if we could "just sprinkle some AI" on their legacy system. Sure, and while we're at it, let's just sprinkle some unicorn dust too! 

Remember:
Agile took years to mature
DevOps wasn't built in a day
And AI/ML isn't a magic wand

The fundamentals matter. The math matters. The data matters. And yes, understanding gradient descent matters (even if it sounds like a scary ski slope).

So before you pivot your entire career to "AI Solutions Architect," maybe take a breath, grab some popcorn, and actually learn the foundations?

After all, even Woody had to come to terms with Buzz's arrival... eventually.
posts.commentAdded: Great analogy! Its so important to focus on the fundamentals before jumping on the latest trends. Solid foundation leads to true innovation! üåü
